text:
Hi
Can we update hubdb table row by use hubl ?
Thanks
<@UPXNCC5J5> hubl is for showing data, not updating it.. you can use the hubdb api for updating hudb rows
you can call the api using json calls through javascript, if you wanna do it through a custom module or something like that

Hi, all. I'm using this for loop in a HubDB table for events:

`{% for row in hubdb_table_rows(dynamic_page_hubdb_table_id, "&orderBy=-start_date&start_date__lt=0s&limit=12") %}`

to return past events. I have a Date and Time column in my events HubDB table (start_date). From my understanding here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/hubdb/v2/get_table_rows>

`start_date__lt=0s`

should return events less than (lt) the current time (0s). The time is off by 6 hours for some reason. Do you see any issues in my code? If not, any ideas as to why its 6 hours off?
I think our system time is in UTC, thats why u see that diff..
Ok, so if I add 6 hours to my filter, that should fix it.
we have these clients for js <https://docs.google.com/document/u/1/d/e/2PACX-1vTuu12oFF4bQY1zVD2-WKFuM2dEDN81-fZRV1tGaCL5Z_OcjC-B6O3mHXR6chaq25BU1D2FuvKIjc49/pub>
good point. is there a better way to write this?
